Dragon Slayer (Song)--Bard(24), Red Dragon Disciple(10), Champion of Torm(6)
By Tyr Templar

Author’s Note:
This build is the second of two characters in my Dragon Slayer series as is set out in the companion build, together with the history and revisions and which can be found here: dragon-slayer-sword-bard8-rdd10-cot22-t2294858.html . This series is being revisited in light of the 1.69 Patch. Tied to this series is a wonderful story about the Dragon Slayer, a brave and noble knight who, in the process of slaying dragons finds himself bathed in dragon blood, the magical properties of which transform him into a half-dragon. Whereas the Dragon Slayer (Sword) is a PG/drake melee warrior which focuses on the sword (high/PG AB and among other things really high saves so as to enjoy dev.crit with impugnity!); this character instead focuses on the Song, there being two different aspects of dragons of old, and which were equally known for their ferocity, strength and prowess in battle as they were their magic and song, with both aspects being examined by this series in turn. That story can be found in the companion build linked above, along with the Sword variant itself in the event you should prefer the Sword over the Song. What follows is the Dragon Slayer Song variant, the first bolstered by dev.crit (because, as the story says, a Dragon doesn't like it when a human happens along when s/he's singing a song!) followed by a non-dev.crit version (so as to focus on magic, with meta-magic feats and a better song; enjoying Lasting Inspiration and a nice AC/defense as well).

May the legend of the Dragon Slayer live on! ~ Tyr

some feedback - I just played the non-dev crit build up to level 30 on an action server and it was quite powerful (annoying to have to unequip armor/shield to buff, but manageable).

Instead of these start stats
STR: 17 (40), DEX: 8. CON: 14 (16). WIS: 8, INT: 14 (16), CHA: 13 (16)
you instead start with 16 STR, that will give you 3 extra stat points: put 1 extra into CHA at the start (start with 14 instead of 13) and use the level 32 stat bump for STR instead of CHA, allowing you to end with the same 40 STR and 16 CHA, but leaving extra 2 starting points for either DEX or WIS to start at 10 instead of 8.
